description:
Why haven't I eaten here sooner?? Their sandwiches are purely mouthwatering deliciousness. I came right when they opened at 11 and there were already a few customers trickling behind me. I ordered the porchetta and the chicken grec. The porchetta came with arugula and a good amount of meat. The chicken grec was saucy and flavorful. I really appreciate the bread in the chicken grec, not too tough on my teeth, but soft and also crisp enough :). I tried the cucumber shrub which is a bubbly drink. My bf thought it tasted too similar to pickles, but I didn't think so. I liked the drink but would rather try their other flavors like guava! 

Parking isn't easy around here. The entire block is metered unless you get lucky on the street (2hr parking w/o residential permit). I'd come back and try their other sandwiches. Everything and anything from Belinda is good and worthwhile. If you haven't, I recommend walking over to B patisserie!!
author: Debby N.

description:
Bottom line: go here for lunch

What to get: the B nut and seed salad (crunchy, sweet, veggies, delicious!), the chicken grec sandwich (flavors are great, but had to remove almost half the filling to be able to bite into it, it's huge).

When to go: lunch. Small, order-at-the-counter cafe with a handful of tables. Not the kind of place for a leisurely lunch, more of a eat and run or takeout.
author: K R.

description:
Don't be fooled by how petite the sandwich looks. It is full of flavor and the perfect amount for lunch. Simplistic store that gives it a modern appearance. Accomplishes exactly what you look for in a quick stop for lunch. 

Pork belly banh mi: big slab of fatty pork belly right in the center of the sandwich with savory pickled carrots and daikon. Topped off with a kick from the jalepeno and cilantro. Baguette was soft on the inside and crunchy on the out, but did leave a few sore spots on my palate typical in eating a banh mi. 

Porchetta: savoury, fatty, and moist. Pork was shredded in the ciabatta type bread and covered with an assortment of vegetables. 

Really impressed with the sandwich and keeps me wondering what the B stands for. I brainstormed ideas that it could be Belinda on the Go, or Bread on the go. For now, I am going with Banh mi on the Go.
author: Ronald M.

description:
I loved this place and will return once I get back to the Bay Area.  I got th Banh mi and it was most-likely the perfect sandwich for me.  Served on a fresh crispy roll stuffed with Chinese bbq port belly, with tons of cucumber, jalapeño, pickled carrots and daikon.  The menu says soft roll but the outside of the roll was crunch while the inside soft fluffy whiteness so good.   I also got a bite of my friend's porchetta and that was good too.  Might have to order the on the next go around.  A second friend ordered the Bnut & seed salad.  That was good too and I loved the light honey mustard dressing served with the salad.
It's a simple but well pulled together restaurant and serve is very good and fast.  I'll be back to try the rest of the menu.
author: debi k.

description:
Delicious, I can't wait to go back.

I saw the menu was very simple: Bahn mi sandwiches or the same made into a salad for a dollar more.

I chose the pork belly and it was delicious diced into morsels over tender greens and cilantro leaves and lightly tossed in a vinaigrette.

The roasted Brussels sprouts looked tantalizing and I couldn't say "no" when I read they're accompanied by aioli. The aioli tasted like it had lemon zest; it had a nice zing. 

I wish I'd asked for the aioli on the side because it was a little too much and swamped the sprouts. 

I saw the much-talked-about rotisserie oven behind the counter but nothing was roasting. That said, it might've been too much to bear waiting in a long but fast-moving line at lunchtime!

I ordered "the shrub", a lightly carbonated drink with a mix of lime and mint- refreshing.

I took home a piece of olive oil cake and while I liked it, I was expecting a denser cake, not one that was fluffy. It was just okay.

B on the Go was busy on an average Wednesday, impressive and speaks to the restaurant's quality.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Oh man, this is definitely my new favorite sandwich shop! I already love b patisserie for their flat breads and pastries but I've recently been coming here for their sandwiches and they have all been tasty! There's usually a short line but orders come out real fast!

I've tried the weekend special fried chicken sandwich and it was amazing. The batter is perfectly crispy, slightly spicy and incredibly juicy inside. I loved how it's topped with some honey and sausage gravy. It's definitely a hearty sandwich but I'm glad I got to try it after seeing all these pictures of it! I also tried the porchetta sandwich and it's the most tender pork I've ever had. It also goes so well with the veggies and the chicarrones. I am literally drooling as I wrote this review! I'm glad it's so close to me cause I'll definitely be back for more in the future! 


Oh yeah, don't forget to try out some the pastries in the display. The cherry oat toffee cookie is out of this world! It sounds like a weird combo but it's really amazing! We also shared a butter mochi and it reminds me of Hawaii and I'm absolutely in love with it. I've ordered a slice every time I've gone! 


Total for 2: $35
author: Stella J.

description: We were walking Pacific Heights and got lost, ended up walking up the Lyon street steps, and then thought we might die, so we needed water and food. Anything would have sufficed, but we got LUCKY to stumble onto B on the go. Stand in the line and order a unique sandwich on wonderful bread. I got the Veggie--loaded with cauliflower and carrots. The sauce was yummy. I added a little Sirachia to give it some kick because I'm addicted to spice. We also had a side of Brussels sprouts which were cheesy and creamy. The tomato bisque was excellent, too. Very creamy. I left very full!
author: Christy C.

description:
Psst. 

Everyone is here for the chicken Greco sandwich which is a throwback to Belinda Leong's stint in Paris. But now that you've read my review, you know to get the porchetta sandwich: the succulent pork is stuffed into a chewy house made ciabatta slathered in a tangy chimichurri sauce with crispy cracklins aplenty. The arugula brightens up the meat and adds a nice peppery touch to the sandwich. It's no RoliRoti, but when you're far away from the Ferry Building and you can get a porchetta sandwich right here, right now, you go for it! Pair it with their tomato bisque and you got yourself a satisfying meal.

I sat on the corner spot which lets in plenty of warm sunshine and I can watch the line at b patisserie across the street. If I'm too lazy to cross over, I can still enjoy a classic b chocolate chip cookie without having to stand in that crazy weekend line. 

And I do just that.
author: Janice C.

description:
Mmmmmm. So delicious. Don't miss this place   if you are in the area. 

Had the hot roast beef sandwich with peppers and it was amazing. Also got the tomato bisque with housemade croutons -- yummy. The tuna melt is my favorite and the Brussels sprouts. 

Also got an olive oil cake.

Love this place!!!
author: Christine V.

description: Just love this place, simple great food prepared and served up with no attitude. Soup and a sandwich always in good taste. Slightly out of the way, however it's just a short walk to and from Sue Fisher King so it's just the perfect combination.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Cheers.  Tears.
Rudolph nose.  Frosty Toes.
Rage on the road.  Bundled up in this SF cold.
Couples discussing Christmas plans.  Friends get together hand in hand.

Then there's me.  Sometimes it's nice to enjoy a nice meal alone while observing all the action from your surroundings.  The holidays are nearing which means stress from shopping; fear of spending this season alone; 12 days of sweet treats or tiny gifts; and empty streets (goodbye transplants!).  

I might be bias because I love everything Ms. B produces... probably her kids too if she has/will have any.  The tomato bisque has a nice consistency, good flavor, and the perfect amount.  It's a comforting dish that warms the soul.  The salad is fresh and the dressing is subtle but just enough.
author: Linda N.

description:
Was pleasantly tickled by the open, clean and lots of windows restaurant space. Ordered the chicken grec-it was very tasty, filling and was presented adorably on a wooden platter. The yogurt sauce was on point! Refreshing taste to the soft rotisserie chicken and veg filling in a large bun. A banh mi equivalent to a gourmet level.
They also had tejava tea, ftw.

Will definitely come here again next time I'm in the neighborhood. Chic, tasty and was satisfied!!
author: Summer S.

description:
B on the Go is one of my favorite lunch spots in SF. Their Bahn Mi salad is loaded with cilantro and pork belly. I don't know how they do it, but you get to eat pork belly with zero guilt! It's somehow only slightly fatty but still flavorful. Their roasted Brussels sprouts are fantastic as well. 

After your (somewhat) healthy salad, you can continue to indulge with either the small but tempting selection of baked goods they serve here or walk a block over to b. Patisserie.
author: Charles L.

description: I got 2 sandwiches  to go and share with my hubby. He mention it was small compared with the other ones we buy for the same price. We really l
author: Lydia H.

description: I just moved here from Texas and this is the first thing I have tried in the city! Omgshhhhh the Gobbler sandwich I am dying. The cheese on it and the aioli- man oh man I can't wait to come back and try the other sandwiches!!! The environment is super chill. Went for lunch at about 12:30- line out the door and worth the fuss- thanks B!!
author: Micah L.

description:
Lunch review. Takeout.

Grilled cheese sandwich (Duxelles) - 4

Rotating fruit shrub+

Overall, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
I can't believe I hadn't heard of this place until today! I was working from home and looked up a place to grab a quick take out lunch and  this place popped up on Yelp. I ordered online and picked it up 30 minutes later and I was 100% satisfied with my order. I got the chicken sandwich toasted and it was 

Definitely going back.
author: Daniel C.

description: Rich people go here. You can FEEL it. It's got a rich people safety aura about it. I felt HELLA safe inside, though more brown than I actually am. The sandwiches here are good but feel like somebody took a traditional sandwich, like a Banh Mi, and gave it a haircut, made it wear clothes that fit, took it to elocution classes and changed its name to Winston. Something just feels uncomfortably inauthentic about the place. But safe as f#ck. Don't trip about that. Seriously. If you're in the mood to have lunch surrounded by wealthy people and eat a Banh Mi clone that's good but just kinda off, visit this place.
author: Mario T.

description:
Good sandwiches, but not the best. The sauce on the Chicken Greco needed morevflavor. I've actually made a similar sandwich at home and I think a little more lemon juice and salt would've done the trick. The porchetta was much better. The tomato bisque was delicious and the croutons tasted excellent before reaching that soggy point.

I like that there are different cookies and desserts offered here than at B Patisserie.
author: Shannon L.

description: This place gets really busy pretty quickly and they don't take phone orders. But the prices are cheap and the food is really good. There are a lot of healthy options too so it's a great place to go if you forgot your food at home and need something quick and easy.
author: Jason T.

description:
I've come here twice now and haven't been able to pull myself away from the fried chicken and gravy sandwich. It's a huge chunk of chicken and it's cooked to perfection. It has some type of marmalade or jam that tastes amazing. I highly recommend. My wife loves their tuna melt, so if you like tuna melts, there's is solid. Their other sandwiches look really good too. I definitely plan to return to try them out as well. 

We love this spot for breakfast/brunch/lunch. It has the same high quality food as the next good brunch spot in the city without the wait time. Also, it's across the street from B patisserie which has amazing pastries. We typically swing by there afterwards for a few treats. Honestly, the B combo is the way to go.
author: Renato S.

description:
B on the Go is B. patisserie's encore as an adorable rustic-themed cafe featuring artisan roast meat and fresh bread with the same legendary baking skillz. It's my go-to lunch spot in Pac Heights because it has more substantial food than the pastries galore at b.pat and is far more reasonably priced than the gluten-free pretentiousness of As Quoted. 

As the name implies, B on the Go specializes in lunch items such as sandwiches, soups, salads, and fancy shrub drinks with a small but enticing pastry case of giant cookies, canales, olive oil madeleines, etc. For those who are really on the go, they have a basket of prepared sandwiches and boxed salads.

The CHICKEN GREC is a popular sandwich with rotisserie chicken and yogurt sauce sprinkled generously with dill for a pleasantly earthy dimension. The chicken was simple but good, succulent but without much roasty rotisserie robustness. Frankly I was more impressed with the dill yogurt sauce, which accompanied the fresh bread well.

I couldn't say no to PORCHETTA ($10.75). It was the best of all worlds, with pork as tender as pork belly and crispy skin that reminded me of Chinese roast pork. The house ciabatta was wonderfully soft, and the salsa verde tasted like chimichurri. It could have used more arugula, but overall I think I actually like it more than Roli Roti because the meat is warmed on the grill and isn't as salty. 

The GRILLED CHEESE ($8) was simple perfection. They cleverly use a flat bread and fold it over the cheese and mushrooms, so it's shaped like a quesadilla. The thin toasty bread is extra crispy, contrasting the melty filling made even heartier with mushroom duxelle.

I think my least favorite item were the ROASTED BRUSSEL SPROUTS ($4), mainly because there was too much of a mayo-like sauce on top. (So much for attempts to be healthy) The lemoniness was a fitting addition to the Brussel sprouts, but again it was overpowering. It didn't help that I had decided to get this with the tomato bisque, so it was sour on sour. I am still a fan of the lemon/parmesan/anchovy roasted Brussel sprouts idea, but the execution definitely needs more balance.

The TOMATO BISQUE ($4) had good flavor, except it was scalding hot. I actually burnt the roof of my mouth trying to eat the hot, soup-soaked croutons so that they wouldn't get soggy. Oh, first world problems... 

Another popular item is the ARLETTE ($3), apparently made from the same dough as the legendary kouign aman. It does indeed have a delightful flakiness, now in crispy form and tasting like cinnamon toast crunch. I do think it's a bit too sugary, but otherwise a memorable dessert. 

The giant cookies are enticing as well, and I have tried a CHERRY OATMEAL TOFFEE cookie. It's quite sweet with cherries throughout and caramelized from the toffee, making a very satisfying dessert. You enjoy a nice texture from the oatmeal (also gives you an excuse because oatmeal is good for you.) 

The ambiance is quite unique (and not hipster for once!) featuring wooden tables/chairs, an open-air kitchen, and a painting of a perky pig so cute that you will definitely feel guilty eating porchetta here :x There are even hoof prints painted on the other wall! 

Service is friendly and the food is prepared within a reasonable amount of time, though it could take longer than expected due to mobile orders and catering. 

*Closed on Mondays, which is unfortunately the day most in need of grab-and-go gourmet lunches :3
author: Edna C.

description: I work in construction a couple of blocks away and hadn't noticed B on the go until the large rotisserie caught my eye one morning when I was out for a walk. I popped in the next day and ordered the porchetta sandwich with a tomato bisque soup. I have to admit $11 is a lot for a sandwich but this was 100% worth it. The ingredients are fresh and the mix of crunchy chicharrones and slow roasted pork was a unique and satisfying combination. The soup was also clearly homemade and very flavorful. 5 Stars.
author: Zach H.

description: Cute spot to grab lunch.  I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup, the soup was really good- very creamy.  Also, enjoyed their cookies, the oatmeal with cranberries was a tasty treat.  I would definitely come back next time i'm in the area.
author: Makayla A.

description:
Only tried the Chicken Greco sandwich so far.  Pretty good quality bread and chicken (if you're comparing to a Safeway sandwich), but overpriced IMO at $12 for an 8 inch sandwich.  If you want a good quality deli sandwich and don't care about the price, do it to it...but otherwise maybe pass.  I'd definitely come back to try other items though....their porchetta looked pretty juicy.

That said, it's still a cute place to grab lunch at.  And B.patisserie is right across the street...which is always a win.
author: Mon T.

description:
First time here! The atmosphere is rustic and charming. It has an open kitchen so that you can see them make your sandwiches and salads. Right up front is their rotisserie chicken oven!

Hubby had the Grilled Ham and White Cheddar sandwich which came out hot and gooey and very tasty!  I was going to order a sandwich from their menu board but was smitten by their pre-made turkey sandwich with tomatoes, pickled onions, white cheddar cheese, pickles and bacon on a ciabatta roll. The flavor mix was delicious with the sweet onions and tart pickles and the added savory bacon! Yum! We will coming back to try the other sandwiches!
author: Lena L.

description:
So, B Patisserie is right across the street! (BIG PLUS)
I would say they are good for a quick lunch. Pork sandwiches (Porchetta) is pretty good, though quality varies each visit. As well - try the huge chocolate walnut cookies! Massively, delicious cookies at the counter. There are many other sandwiches and things on the menu I have yet to try with my wife. I do recommend stopping here for something savory before going across the street to B. P. for something sweet!
author: Kirk M.

description: The porchetta sandwich was delicious!  The Greek salad was perfectly fresh with feta cheese that did not disappoint.  I will be back.
author: Mary L.

description:
Oh
My
God

This is the best porchetta I've ever had
It's one of the best sandwiches I've ever had
The soft pork with bits of crispy skin
The perfect bread

The pastries are to die for as well

You have to try this place
author: Robin H.

description:
Hmmm, I love their patisserie but not so sure about this place.

I've had their potatoes, they are okay.

I also tried their grilled cheese with mushroom, and it wasn't that great either.

Prices here don't make sense. I may try something else though.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Consider changing the name to B on the Slow. 

The food here is very good and the quality of ingredients is evident. This is why you will pay $10 for a tuna melt. But aside from potentially blowing your lunch budget, you can count on going over whatever time you put on the parking meter.

From the time I placed my order to the time my grilled cheese was handed to me was 14 minutes. Additionally, the customers in line seem perpetually confused that the menu is on the wall near the entry and not at the cashier, which slows things further.  

B on the Slow is not bad, it's just going to take a while.
author: Horace A.

description: I'm a glutton for punishment.  I keep giving B on the Go another try. Today it was their corned beef special.  Desultory service as usual. And for $10.75 a sandwich that I didn't finish -- not because it was so big, just because it was tasteless.  I give up.  As much as I'd like a creative sandwich shop in my neighborhood, this just isn't good enough.
author: Robin W.

description: Amazing sandwiches! Especially the vegetable banh mi, and that's coming from someone that hates vegetables.
author: Linz C.

description: I got the Bahn Mi and it was nothing extraordinary. For the price, I expected more; it was a bit too salty and the ingredients could be distributed better. The meat was good but I wish they'd put more carrots and daikon into it, the last few bites were missing 'em.
author: Christine Z.

description: Great find in a city full of phenomenal restaurants... the food and atmosphere were fantastic.
author: Steven R.

description:
I had been to their patisserie across the way many times and was headed there for a lunch meeting with a colleague.  We saw that the line was out the door so we decided to visit the lunch spot instead.  

As the name indicates, it is more of a quick service "to go" location but there is a community table and about 7 other tables to sit down and meet with others.  I do wish that this place (and the patisserie)had wifi and longer hours.  I deduct one star here for that.  

But if you want a nice place with different sandwiches there were so many on the board that sounded interesting to me.  After consulting with the guy behind the counter, I went with the Roasted Cauliflower Banh Mi and an Orangina.

The sandwich came fairly quickly and was very tasty. Much better than I had thought with a zesty mayo sauce and banh mi vegetable slaw. Would definitely get this sandwich again as a vegetarian option although I saw other sandwiches people were eating and they all looked good.

The place got pretty full on a Friday and we did feel like we couldn't have a long meeting there as people were waiting to sit at our table.
author: Erik H.

description:
The fiancé and I were in the mood for something savoury so we decided to stop by B on the Go, the famous b. Patisserie's more savoury sister. Right away we walked up to the glass counter and had a tough time deciding what to get- I wanted to get everything! 

We ended up getting the roast beef sandwich with roasted peppers, provolone, and herbed mayo. Oh the herbed mayo: if I could buy a tub of it and bathe in it I would :) The sandwich was perfectly crisped and all the flavours just worked together perfectly. 

The icing on the cake was seeing owner Belinda Leong herself while we were there!
author: Ashley L.

description:
This is a nice space with friendly staff and good food.  Definitely a top spot to drop by if you're in the neighborhood.

I enjoyed a casual lunch here on Sunday with a tuna melt and guava shrub (drink).  The tuna melt was one of the better I've had in the city, though I would have liked more cheese.  In my absolute perfect world, that cheese would be American (doesn't harden as quickly as Cheddar), but I know that's too much to hope for at a fancier spot in SF....

The sandwich was made fresh in just a few minutes.  The shrub was freshly compiled to order pretty much instantly (they add ice and club soda to the prepared shrub).

The reason this is 4 and not 5 stars is due to their lack of signature baked goods.  I had to walk to the normal location after lunch for a chocolate chip cookie, which seems silly.

Nonetheless, I'd definitely return when in the area!
author: Tay H.

description: Stopped in today to try the hot beef sandwich. What can I say, that was one damn good sandwich. Tender beef, sautéed yellow and red sweet pepper, cheese, and a nice aioli. I was hooked on their Greek chicken, but this beef sandwich has taken the top honors. You have to try it.
author: Anthony W.

description: Best bahnmi I've ever had in my life. Pork belly melts in your mouth. The only downside is their hours are terrible - they close before dinner every night.  If you can make it in the limited time they are open, absolutely get the pork belly bahnmi.
author: Maggie H.

description: Expected nothing but greatness from this place and they delivered.  I liked their porchetta sammich more than Roli Roti.  The bread to meat ratio plus their whatever sauce they slabbed on it was great.  Which it had a bit more crunchies (pork skin) but it was good enough.  Add a side of tomato soup and and you'll be very happy.
author: Vince L.

description: Man get your act together! Inconsistent cooking of your Brussel sprouts (not the 1st time either), they were under cooked & impossible to break down. Think chewing bubble gum, it never breaks down right? Right ... so when I give my feedback at the counter, what do I get? "Oh sorry, I'll tell my manager". NO, NO, NO. The answer should be would you like a refund or can I offer you something else. Unbelievable! I won't be coming back & that's that.
author: Henry K.

description:
Review only for Fried Chicken Sandwich:

I don't live in the area, but I would specifically drive to "B on the Go" for their Fried Chicken Sandwich, only served on weekends. I've tried many well-known fried chicken sandwich (8 to 10 different) places in San Francisco. None of them even came close to the quality and price of the Fried chicken sandwich at B on the Go. Each sandwich came with a huge piece of thigh meat (1 to 2-inch-thick), fried perfectly (juicy inside) with a cheddar cheese and I think sausage gravy. They sold the sandwich at $10, which was a steal. Could have been sold easily for $15 (considering the mark up everywhere in SF). The Fried chicken sandwich would kill any competition in the city. I'm writing this review to give the chef props (I think it was the guy with the short mohawk). That fried chicken sandwich was d@mn good. Seriously underappreciated and could easily stand-alone by itself. I liked it as much as the cheese burger from Ricky Bobby when it did exist. I hesitated to write a review on the fried chicken sandwich because I thought it might become too popular and it would run out by the time I would get there on the weekend.  

I went last weekend to discover the sandwich has been discontinued. Deeply sadden by this news. Please bring it back or encourage the guy to bring it back somewhere else so everyone else can enjoy it again. I think the fault was the marketing of the sandwich. You would never know it existed. Only if you walked into the restaurant and read it on a paper by the register. At least put up some signs outside or something. 

I'm not knocking the other options at the place. I think they do a great job. This is specifically related to the fried chicken sandwich. It was sooo d@mn good! RIP to another good sandwich in SF (RIP Ricky Bobby)
author: Jonathan C.

description: The salads were so fresh and tasty.  Had the roast beef and Banh Mi; so delicious!  One of the best sandwich places in the city.  Bread is baked there fresh! Staff is friendly - get there early as there is a line.
author: Frank G.

description:
I wish I could eat lunch here everyday. It's such a great soup/salad/sandwich spot. There is normally a place to sit too! I wish it was a little less expensive though. 

The chicken grec, tuna melt, and veggie banh mis are my favorite sandwiches. The tomato soup and brussels sprouts are my favorite sides. You do order with the cashier, but it is kind of confusing when you first get there.
author: Lauren A.

description: Love the dessert items as well as the stoats beef sandwich! Perfect lunch spot with gourmet ingredients!
author: Nathalie B.

description:
Decent sandwich selection. They even had two types of banh mi, but I opted for The Cubano. Good portion and I was full afterward.  I knew the sandwich would have pickles, but not as much it did. I ended up picking it out. 

Nice clean space, there's small individual tables and there's a communal table in the centre.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Nicest ever lady with blond hair with great smile and great attitude helped me today. she is also Gluten Free so she was so helpful in helping me find some great options for a late lunch!

Banh Mi sandwich (made gluten free) - turned into all the ingredients without the bread put over a salad. it was AMAZING. so much meat (pork)- and lots of yummy ingredients that paired really well with the salad beneath it. they even took the cilantro off per my request which was great too. (I don't like cilantro)

We had the GF Mochi butter cake for dessert - my asian aunt makes these and these mochi cakes were legit - very similar to what she usually makes from her authentic ethnic mochi flour recipe book. 

Thanks B on the Go fo an amazing gluten free lunch that was both delicious and very filling and some pretty amazing customer service as well! I will be back!
author: Win H.

description:
It always surprises me when a sandwich is really delicious, because, well ... it's just a sandwich! 

But the Gobbler (turkey, bacon, tomatoes, and other yummy) ($9) is one of those "damn. This is freaking yummy" sandwiches that you're thinking of eating again AS YOU'RE EATING IT. 

The tomato bisque ($4) didn't have croutons since I got it to go, but it's a textured not smooth version and it's nothing to write home about. 

The salted caramel chocolate cake ($3.75 for a baby slice) has a lovely flavor that lives up to its name.
author: Crystal M.

description:
I came for a late brunch having stopped by the sister b. patisserie for some grab and go pastries to bring here. The menu is simple and not overloaded, a couple of fairly conservative takes on classic sandwiches. The baked goods here are different and simpler than the flagship bakery. As a Viet person, banh mi isn't the same outside of a hole in the wall setting and doesn't quite ring right with high quality meats (cha lua is usually some mystery meat) or ingredients. b.'s take on it a simple, tasty sandwich that isn't a California fusiony watered down version. 

You can also get the sandwiches as a salad for $1 extra. Chicken salads are as basic an item you can get, but b. is one of my favorite in SF. Rotisserie chicken was juicy, flavorful, perfect yogurt tzatziki sauce, right about of greens and other stuff. The only thing I would change were the tomatoes were those pulpy neutered flavorless kind that you throw on burgers. Had it been heirloom or more flavorful, it would have been the perfect salad. Love that the salad option is there to balance out the carb overload from the baked goods at the neighboring patisserie if you're as gluttonous as I am made stops at both :)

I went at a slow time but impressed by the fast service. The food was out almost immediately after ordering. Props for that. Communal table, sunny atmosphere, nice service, pretty good price for a solid lunch or brunch option. I wouldn't go out of the way to come here the way that I would for b. patisserie, but would definitely come again when I'm in Lower Pac.
author: Truc N.

description: 2nd time here kinda turned me off! Had to try the cherry shrub and wanted a cup of ice for my hydroflask! She said she couldnt give me one since she might run out for the rest of day and her customers! Your patiserrie is just across the street! I dont see an issue if one of your employees bring you a bucket full from across the street! #smh
author: Alaric S.

description: The absolute best sandwiches! We stopped by to see the full house, and decided to get a bite close to where we were. The building is just beautiful. Nice open seating, even when crowded. They have a beautiful rotisserie case. Fresh everything! We ordered the roast beef and the chicken grec. It was FABULOUS! Perfectly grilled bread for the roast beef, and the rotisserie chicken was to die for. I wish we had ordered the rotisserie potatoes, which sit at the bottom on the case and are covered in spices and drippings.  I got a brownie to go. The only mistake was not getting two! The best brownie. Crunchy out side. Gooey inside this place is a ten.
author: Kelsey S.

description: I have come to this place quite a few time and they have messed up my order at least half of the time. I have a food allergy and they are not capable of making my meal the way it needs to be made so that I don't get sick. I have been guaranteed that my order was made dairy free (not complicated) when they hand it to me. I guess I can't trust this place anymore. Never will I patronize this establishment ever again.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Noelle's Yelp Notebook 2015

I'm in love...

with B. on the Go and B. Patisserie - whom I love more, I cannot decided as they both are equally amazing in their own right :) 


Upon entering one will note:
the delicious smell of food being cooked
beautiful black and white floral patterned tiles
one long wooden communal table
gorgeous ceiling tiles (if you look up)
one bright yellow mustard colored rotisserie oven
freshly baked bread behind the glass partition 

I always order the porchetta sandwich sans the salsa verde (due to my cilantro allergy). The porchetta sandwich is comprised of the freshly made porchetta meat and leafy greens on freshly baked bread- the meat is seasoned well and is melt in your mouth delicious, there are crisy bits of the porchetta which is literally the icing on the cake. My toddler absolutely loves their ham and cheese sandwich. Other items my family & friends have ordered are the Chicken Grec, Cubano- which everyone has loved and given 5/5 Yelp stars :)

olive Oil Madelines are to die for 5/5
chocolate Cremeux is good 3.5/5
lemon Sable Cookie 4/5
banana Panna Cotta 5/5 (I'm allergic to bananas but my toddler love it!)
peanut butter cookie 5/5 (I'm allergic but my family and friends loved it!)
oatmeal cookie 5/5 (It contains nuts. (I'm allergic but my family and friends loved it!)
chocolate chip cookie 5/5 one of the best I've had and I'm a chocolate chip cookie fan

Customer service is outstanding all the time- they have handled my large orders for family and friends with grace and were quite efficient, all the while noting my allergies and making sure my order was correct. This is my go to spot for my most favorite sandwich ever- porchetta :)

Noelle's Notes
Delicious sandwiches
Great cold brew coffee
Excellent customer service (Adrian you're awesome!)
author: Noelle J.

description: My favorite new lunch spot, in a central location. The quality and taste is excellent for the efficiency of a lunch time order. The bread for the sandwiches is just the right amount of soft to melt after a bite but strong enough to hold the weight of all its contents. I've tried the chicken grec and tomato bisque and highly recommend both for their rich flavors! I can't wait to try other items on the menu soon.
author: Belle S.

description:
Sadly unimpressed the quality and pricing of their food. The vegetable banh mi was served on a cute wood plate, but was swimming in a pool of oil. The flavor of the cauliflower was tasty, but nothing to write home about. Just found it to be very greasy and oily. 

The boyfriend got the ham & cheese sandwich which was also decent, but nothing special.

For the price, I found it to be overpriced which I wouldn't mind paying if the food was above average, which I didn't feel it was. Decent food at above normal prices. I'll continue to frequent the original B patisserie for my pastry fix.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
Cool ambiance and location.

But...

Banh Mi sandwich was not good. Waaaaaay too much mayo. Pork Belly was nearly all fat. I didn't bother to finish the sandwich, which is rare for me.
author: Hamrez S.

description:
The food and service were perfect.

It is 2 blocks away from my house but only open for lunch. The double whammy of my diet for my wedding in less than 30 days, and being away on most weekends has barred me from this experience.  

Today is a Sunday and I was in SF and I felt like I needed a little treat.  The Chronicle waxed poetic about the grilled cheese, so that was what I ordered. It was small (but that works for the diet) but the mushrooms were savory and plentiful, the bread was crispy and not greasy, the cheese was fully melted.  Quite a little treat this place was...I am dying to try the greek chicken and the porchetta sandwiches next.

The service is very sweet and earnest. They want you to enjoy their food.
author: Amy W.

description: My friend and I loved this place! I'm not a fan of Bahn Mi, as it looks dry and stuffed with vegetables. Boy could I be more wrong! There's some clear sauce all over it that makes it the most flavorful. I had the cauliflower bahn mi and my friend had the chicken sandwich. He love them so much that he got 3 of each to go! The scrubs are awesome too! Perfect lunch.
author: Kym P.

description:
So excited to finally try B on the Go.  If only they sold the kouign amann here too.  Seating here is limited and at a communal table.  We all came here after our workout.  He and I shared the Porchetta and the chicken grec sandwiches.  Others got a Cubano with a curry quinoa salad and a chicken grec with a cookie.  

Both sandwiches could have used a little more meat but were high quality.  The porchetta ($11.50) had bits of crisp skin and nice moist bits of pork, but the salsa verde was too sour.  The salsa verde made me not want more than a few bites.  Loved the bread it was served on too, it was just that dang sauce!  I loved the Chicken Grec ($10.50), it was served on a french roll filled with rotisserie chicken, herbed yogurt, onions, and lettuce and tomato.  

Had a bite of the curry quinoa salad, it was nice and light.  I would definitely get this if I wanted something really light to tide me over.  Friendly and quick service.   If the Porchetta's salsa wasn't so sour then I think it could be on par with Roli Roti's or Split Bread's.  Prices are a little up there, but then again, it's expected.  4 stars for now.  Can't wait to try other things here, the menu is limited, but it seems like they may be adding things or experiment as well.
author: Cat C.

description: Little B as I like to call it offers excellent lunch on the go, well, sort of on the go because the line backs up around lunch and can take 20 minutes or more, so get there around 11:30 before the rush. There is a reason though for the line, the food. It's excellent. The bread, the most vital part of a sandwich, is expectedly fresh. The chicken and dill salad sandwich was excellent with my only complaint being they should def use fresh dill as opposed the dry stuff they are throwing in the mix-- makes a big diff. I cannot wait to try their tuna sandwich. I have never seen anything like it. The staff are sweet and professional, and you will for sure leave with a good vibe.
author: Brian J.

description: I just had the banh Mie & it would have to be THE BEST I've ever had. Deliciously tasty, incredibly moorish with a good dose of chilli & tender but crispy pork bits. Seriously good!
author: Nicole E.

description:
Given that they sell grilled cheese, tuna melt, banh mi, and other sandwiches that touched upon various other cuisines who would've thought they were all great. I ended up getting the banh mi with tomato bisque and everything was superb.

The banh mi definitely had that characteristic Vietnamese flair to it despite its simplicity, that's what makes this sandwich great. Pork belly with pickled veggies. Simple, delicious, on point.

Tomato bisque was rich and creamy and pretty much all one can ask for from tomato bisque. Perhaps one minor minor complaint - ask for more croutons! Perhaps it could use a tiny bit more tomato flavor?
author: Melody L.

description:
Finally got around to trying out B on the Go and so glad that I did.
I appreciate the detail and care that they put into their creations -- it is rare to find that level of attention in SF these days.

I highly recommend trying the Tuna Melt-- yes, the tuna. It was prepared to perfection and just the right amount. As one would expect, the porchetta sandwich is notable and did not disappoint but B takes it to the next level by adding little bits of the crunchy skin so you get a little crunch in just about every bite.

We did not try any sweets, however, I was surprised to see that they had some peanut butter cookies on display that were definitely over -- and I don't mean they were on the borderline of being over. I'm sure, or at least I hope, it was a one-off.
author: Maria R.

description:
Was extremely unhappy with the service yesterday. Not only was the cashier with the highlighter yellow glasses rude; they forgot the mushrooms in my grilled cheese twice!  It was a lost cause to try to get it fixed again.  

Oh, and apparently you're not allowed to have water unless you order something.  My friend was pouring water for the table and the cashier with the highlighter yellow glasses asked her "are you going to order something". Wtf?! We were sitting down waiting for our food for about 10 minutes already when he asked that!  Did he think she was homeless and coming to steal water?!  Ugh.
author: Tina L.

description:
Little bit over priced.

Food is good, freshly made.
Open kitchen, nice and simply décor.
author: Natasha L.

description:
Not to be confused with the actual b. patisserie (which is actually right down the street)!! b on the Go seems like a sister shop to some degree. There is a small selection of baked goods - mostly cookies and similar pastries - but they also serve sandwiches. No kouign amanns though :(

Last time I was here, I decided to get two things just for myself - an arlette and a cannele. The arlette was described to me as a flat kouign amann, which convinced me right away. I would say that description is fairly accurate. It is a large flat crisp, essentially just the crispy outer layer of a kouign amann with caramelized sugar. It was delicious, but I did miss having the balance of the crispy outer later together with the light airy inside of a regular kouign amann. 

The cannele was interesting. I had never had anything quite the same before. It was not too sweet and almost a drier version of a bread pudding. I wasn't a huge fan of the cannele personally but it was decent.

I didn't try any of the sandwiches, but pastry-wise I would probably just stick with b. patisserie next time.
author: Tiffany P.

description: Sandwich was okay. I got the banh mi. I love watching Belinda prep the sauce and lunch menu in the back. Bright space and tiles. A bit snooty lady at the counter.
author: Jboogie L.

description: I like how B Patisserie expanded into a separate shop more catered towards sandwiches and quick meals. I ordered the Grec sandwich, which is one of their most popular sandwiches to get here. Right off the bat, the bread they used had a nice crunch to it while still being soft. It was like biting into a baguette that didn't scrape your mouth! However, the actual chicken and the yogurt sauce tasted a little bland and would have benefited from a little more salt. I do plan on going back to try another one of their sandwiches and maybe some of their pastries they sell there too!
author: Spencer E.

description:
Sister to B. Patisserie and not as packed.  Their chicken grec is filled with yogurt goodness.  Didn't get it and was looking at the person across from at the communal table, munching down one.  The yogurt sauce was dripping downwards onto the tray.  It was superbly eye-ogling..

This place is much more laid back compared to their B. patisserie.  Appreciate it for its more open availability and freshness of sammies.  They only do drip coffee compared to espressos at its original place.  If you're not picky, then go for it.

A spot on cafe shop to take it to go or simply chill with what you got.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Came here with the GF, I got the chicken grec (great Mediterranean spin on the chicken salad sando) and she got the veggi bah mi. Both delicious  and the wait wasn't that long on Sunday lunch time.
author: Ethan B.

description:
3.5 stars

I guess I set my expectations too high. Their savory food is definitely not up to par considering this place has the same owner as b. Patisserie across the street. Maybe it's not fair to compare them because BP is insanely good. Anyway, I've tried the chicken grec and grilled cheese with mushrooms. Both good, but not mind-blowing. The menu on the wall is simple - I think there are about 8 different sandwiches. I'd come back to try the porchetta next (even though I'm almost certain that it cannot beat Roli Roti's), but only if I'm already in the area.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Standing in line and and all i can do is stare at the rotisserie chicken spinning over a layer of potatoes. Crispy potatoes with chicken drippings? Yes, you need to come here.I'm a big B. Leong fan. B. Patisserie is my go to and one of my favorite spots in the city. B on the Go is just a quick walk over and it has the same friendly vibe. The greek inspired Chicken Grec is delicious. Just enough tang, savory moist chicken and refreshing veggies. Of course, you'll be tempted by a few select baked goods by the cash register. It's not what i consider a small place but it's popular and you'll have to cross your fingers for a seat during lunch hour.
author: Samantha L.

description: The soft roll they use for bread is really good. I had the Grec, and it was simple and flavorful. The service was friendly. The communal table was surprisingly less awkward than it looked.
author: Morris R.

description:
I finally got to try the cheese melt and wasn't disappointed. The bread was my favorite part: fresh and not at all oily like many other cheese melts. The combination of 3 cheeses and mushrooms was great. 

Skip the shrubs--a drink they make in house! I ordered it with guava favor and it tasted a bit like vinegar. I couldn't even drink it & felt awful...
author: Valerie F.

description:
If you love sandwiches you'll instantly fall in love with this place! They serve porchetta, cubano, chicken greco, banh mi, and more! Seriously, it's like all my favs in 1 spot! This is the greatest hits of sandwiches! 

We ordered the porchetta and cubano with a side of Brussels sprouts. Slices of pork with crunchy skin enveloped in housemade bread - who can resist?! The porchetta was amazing but the 1 thing I wish they would do is warm up the bread. Although, this place had a decent queue and it took maybe 15-20 mins to get our food so warming up the bread would've taken even longer. The cubano was good too but either the pickle or mustard was slightly over powering. The rotisserie brussel sprouts were delicious but they went a little heavy handed with the parmesan and white sauce that resembled mayonnaise. 

Overall, I would definitely come back and try their other sandwiches like chicken greco and of course, a separate order of porchetta so I can save for snack
author: Jen C.

description: Oh, the sandwiches across the corner from B'Patisserie are so delicious. I love the porchetta sandwich, which I've heard to be rated comparable to some of the best native italian sandwich shops. Similarly, don't forget to try a banh mi with pork belly with extra jalapenos and spicy sauce.
author: Jordan H.

description:
A little skeptical at first but my roommate raved about the Vegetable Bahn Mi sandwich so I had to try it.

Uh, TASTY! Served like a regular Bahn Mi but instead of meat it's baked cauliflower and it's delish. Spicy mayo on point. Don't even bother getting the pork belly one, I know you don't know me, but TRUST ME on this. 

Cashier gave me a complemetary cookie (maybe it looked like I was having a bad day?) it was a cherry oatmeal toffee cookie. I was bad and ate the whole thing, couldn't help myself.

Give it a try peeps.
author: Rachel T.

description:
First time in this place and I loved the open ambience. 
My friend and I started off with the Oatmeal cherry toffee cookie because starting with dessert is the way to live a good life! 
It did not disappoint....it was a perfect blend of crispy yet chewy and moist goodness. I'd get some more for sure :)
For the entree...I had the Tuna Melt sandwich and Tomato Bisque soup and my friend had grilled cheese with mushroom and the same soup . 
The flavor was definitely all there but I gave it a 3 star rating because the soup was served COLD! :(
author: Dee R.

description: Love B on the Go! The Bahn Mi sandwich is great. Also don't forget to try their Italian sodas. The day I went, they had one called "Guava Shrub" and it was excellent! A very unique flavor. Their soups are also really great. Fair prices, too!
author: Emily I.

description: I'm so excited to see that my California street fav b. Patisserie has added a kitty-corner lunch location. They're serving delicious sandwiches, I had their excellent chicken grec (chicken with yogurt, cucumbers, etc). They've also got some unique-to-this-location baked goods, but it seems designed to go with their lunch offering rather than be an additional outlet for their bakery. Today was their second day, which meant I didn't have to brave much of a line. Go now before the crowds find out!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
B. on the Go definitely is. little seating inside, a communal table for 12 and a bench by the window.

menu: sammies, salads, drinks, pastries, cookies, sides...
eats: cubano  (10.50)
-"roast pork, ham, mustard, grilled cheese, pickles on ciabatta bread."
-a few slices of meat evident, not tastable. pickle taste most prominent.
-sammie freshly made
2 halves look similar to my flat wallet. cubano tastes a lot better.
3.5 stars

crumbs:
-5 sammie choices posted, daily menu on sheet on counter
-B. operated by B. Patisserie...
author: Victor G.

description:
Happy to see B on the next adventure... within the one block radius of b. patisserie! 

At the corner of California and Divisadero, the old corner market is now b. on the go. I think they expect people to grab and go instead of dining in since there is only 1 communal table with 8-10 seats. Came here during lunch and it wasn't too crowded. Once I purchased my sandwich, someone from the table is ready to leave. 

Very simple menu: sandwiches, 2 choices of salad, a few desserts, and drinks. I think the concept here is straight forward and SIMPLE. Ordered the porchetta sandwich and cubano. 

The porchetta sandwich is similar to Roli Roti's porchetta. For those who haven't had it, go track them down. The pork in the sandwich was moist and juicy. A good balance of meat and fat on each piece. Along with it are greens tossed in slight dressing. They also spread something green on both sides of the bun. Nothing fantastic about the bun, not warm or toasted so don't expect much on that. If they did, I think it'd add a lot more to the whole sandwich. When you bite into the sandwich, there are pieces of crunchiness in there... they put pieces of pork skin in there to add the experience. Loved every bite of it. 

The cubano was very simple - cheese and slices of meat inside then pressed. The cubano does not have a kick in flavor but if you're looking for something simple, this is the one. 

I heard they'll start to have rotisserie whole chicken for sale also. Looking to see the menu expand over time! Now if there's more parking around that area...
author: Kapo T.

description:
Today is opening day, and they completely sold out of everything. That must say something. I got the mushroom grilled cheese, which is on a flat bread, kind of tortilla style. Absolutely delicious! The inside is spacious with community style seating. 

I'll definitely be coming back to try the chicken Grec sandwich, upon recommendation from the manager. Congrats Belinda, and happy birthday!
author: Courtney W.

description:
Lunch on a Thursday afternoon was excellent. Around 1:00 the communal table was fairly full but not packed and we shared a few things. 

The favorite sandwich was the chicken grec. Tasty grilled meat with a strong yogurt sauce made for an excellent sandwich.

The NOT favorite sandwich was the cubano. This was very bland - the flavor-lacking cheese was one of the more prominent tastes. At the very least it needed more mustard, and preferably having either of the meats with some flavor. I would recommend trying something else.

I'd heard good things about the quesadilla so we tried that as well. It was tasty but fairly greasy and could have used something acidic/vinegary to cut the grease.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I absolutely love this place and am thankful this is in the neighborhood. 

So far I have tried the bahn mi and the tuna melt. I think both are the best of each sandwich I have ever had. That's a legit claim. 

The bahn mi has very tender char siu style pork and the pickled veggies are nice and crisp. Comes with a mayo and a soy based sauce. I ALWAYS ask for extra cilantro! I should try the veggie one because the pork one is pretty guilty (but oh so worth it).

The tuna melt. Oh man! The round bread is sliced super super thin and toasted to perfection! Looks like a pita pocket with cheddar, tuna, and tomato. Definitely a must try.
author: Julie T.

description: I got the grilled ham and cheese sandwich on sourdough coupled with a very tasty tomato basil soup. The ambience of the place is lovely, the staff cheerful and helpful. The quality of the ingredients used were top notch. I will definitely be coming back! A quick note, around lunch it is very packed so keep that in mind.
author: Jason P.

description: I love this place. They have the best grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup. Definitely a must try!
author: Sara S.

description:
Awesome! So glad this is here. we need a good lunch place in the neighborhood. I ordered the Cubano it was Delicious and the bread was amazing! Cooked perfectly. I look forward to the menu expanding more sandwich & salad options. Maybe even a nice soup to go with the grilled cheese on a foggy summer day in SF.  :) chairs outside would be great so we can come by with the dog. 
The mango mint drink was also really good. Next time we'll try the chicken sandwich or Porchetta.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I love love love this place! My favorite is the vegetable banh mi. Their grilled cheese sandwich is also amazing.

Space is clean and simple, with a large communal table in the center. Staff is always nice and friendly too. Overall an amazing spot with great sandwiches and I highly recommend it!
author: Zozi S.

description:
I was invited by one of my of friends to have a coffee at the B on the go cafe, since then I have been there three times .
Speaking of coffee , the latte is high quality , kept hot, very tasty and present well.
My immediate observation, was the the presentation of pastries at the counter .
It is kind of difficult to distinguish between the banana croissants and others, as the signs are not very visible and at eye level .
The croissants , are good and tend to be too sweet , ( crispy at times , softer on other occasions )I'm not sure how much sugar is used , if I were the pastry chef I would reduce the sugar intake, especially the chocolate croissant , by which it's already sweet . Probably made by different persons .
The cashier is located at the far right , customers get confused where to pay for their orders .
If I were the Manager , I would have the cashier in the middle of the counter facing the entrance .
The service is good , the people are smiling .
One should pay close attention to noise background coming from the inner bakery!
The Music pick is Mediocre, not compatible with a cafe or Restaurant, too harsh Music. Soft Music or easy listening would be perfect for this place .
The place is very busy , the front door entrance should be re-designed  , the far left entrance door is very hazardous, there is a big step that is hard to see to avoid " liability " in the future .
Can be very challenging to elderly and physically challenged people and pregnant women .
B cafe on the go , could be upgraded to "A" on the go. Some items are over priced , in order to retain customers changes must be made or modified.
Respectfully
author: Yassine C.

description: Just got a porchetta sandwich to go and the amount of fat on it was inexcusable. I spoke with the manager who was very apologetic and gracious. She offered me a refund but I can no longer recommend this place. Very unfortunate.
author: hd r.

description: Stopped in at 12:30 on a weekday and was happy to see that it wasn't too crowded! They have a great selection of hot and cold, veg and meat sandwiches. I did the brussel sprout one as a salad and it was great. Hubby had the tuna melt, also great. The pastries are also super hard to pass up...Good place for a fast, delicious lunch!
author: Jen G.

description:
Wanted to go here for so long to try their sandwiches! I really anticipating their Cubano (after watching The Chef!) and porchetta sandwiches. 

The decor of the joint was very cool with their mix-and-match design. Felt like I was in some Parisian cafe. We ordered the two sandwiches mentioned above, an Orangina, an Arlette, and a chocolate Pot de creme. The Cubano was very good...loved the crispyness of its ciabatta bread! The flavor was pretty good too, but choosing between the two, I really liked the porchetta better. The porchetta had so flavor and I love the crispy skin!!!! NOM!!! Definitely a must try! The Arlette and chocolate pot de creme pastries were AMAZINNNGGGG!!! The arlette tasted like a Cinnamon Toast Crunch! Oh and that pot de creme...that was heaven. 

This place did not disappoint! Their brussel sprout and anchovy sandwich sounds interesting and delicious...that's the next sandwich I'm anticipating!
author: Michelle S.

description: Awesome little place we found wondering on a Sunday. Service was great and the food hit the spot. We had the torta and ham-cheese, both delicious. And if you love brussel sprouts, well add a side of them to your order-they don't disappoint. Bread for the ham and cheese was perfect and the cheese had a very smooth texture-it was melt in your mouth.
author: Anna S.

description:
Awesome spin off/sequel to B Patisserie. To some mushrooms are not appealing but their grilled cheese mushroom sand which rocks my world. I've tried all of the sandwiches and it really just depends on what you're in a mood for because they're all delicious. 

Bottom line this place is so convenient, and although there aren't pastries soaring through the place the very few they have are delicious. You're getting the complete lunch fulfillment. 

I'll always be back :)
author: Shannon P.

description:
Great food, just like the original B Patissery.
However, not quite 'as' good
author: Nelli S.

description:
After indulging at their other store half a block a way, we decided to have an actual meal after just having sugar. 

The service was great, the girl by the cash register (who was very patient as i admired everything) and the guy making the sandwiches.

I got the cold sandwich with chicken, yogurt sauce and cucumber. It was the perfect size, they didn't skimp on meat, and it was super flavorful. 

I definitely want to come back and try more of their sandwiches.
author: Shira S.

description: 3.5 but rounding up since I just got one item. This store is the sister spot to B. Patisserie, and they sell some items exclusive only to their location. We came in to check it out before stopping at B. Patisserie, and it was a very modern and clean space. It wasn't too crowded around 3:30pm on a Saturday since it was close to closing time for them. There were still baked goods available for purchase, and we tried one of their exclusive items, the Arlette. This was a cookie made with kouign amman dough and dusted with cinnamon sugar, and it was good, but too dry/flaky for me. I prefer buttery and chewy consistencies. Although the Arlette was solid, I'd rather go check out the full spectrum of baked goods at B. Patisserie a block down. However, this is a good place to go if you're looking for a sandwich and/or a place to relax since it's not crazy busy.
author: Amy D.

description: Solid sandwich (I had the grec chicken). Definitely a good lunch spot.
author: Steven P.

description: This place is simply amazing!!! The staff is beyond friendly and the food is delicious. We ordered the grilled cheese (with mushrooms), the chicken grec, the cubano, a side of roasted Brussels sprouts, and pumpkin (yes, PUMPKIN!!!) creme brûlée. Everything was beyond amazing. I'm sure I will be dreaming about the pumpkin creme brûlée because it was just that awesome. Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Ashley M.

description: I got the porchetta sandwich here because I am a fan of the one from Roli Roti. I still consider Roli Roti the gold standard, but this was pretty decent version as well!
author: Thomas C.

description:
Ok, I'm in without question. Just got my sweet stash from the sister patisserie across the street.  There were 13 minutes left on the meter, 2 blocks away. Tick, tock. Took a chance.....

There was no line, whew! Staff helped me decide on my sandwich choice. Cubano, for sure! What a great choice! It really is all about the bread.

A bright, clean environment. Friendly and helpful service. I especially took notice of a staff member asking her co-worker how she was feeling. She even offered water to drink. That is kindness in teamwork. It gets passed on to the customers.

Now, go get a sandwich! Please.   

I beat the meter!
author: Debbie T.

description: This review is about their very BAD online ordering app. Who designed this? It is surely not mobile friendly in fact it's mobile hostile. The food is great but not worth enduring the app and they won't let you call. Bad bad bad and now giving up and going elsewhere.
author: Bob C.

description: I love this place the food is amazing. NO parking and very small inside, have to share tables and space.  If you could get past the strollers no problem.  I had the grilled cheese and mushrooms so good.  Took a turkey sandwich to go and gave to husband he loved it. I will be back, Make sure you have plenty a time to spare, lines and looking for parking.
author: Susie S.

description: Came here on a weekend afternoon to grab their sandwiches to try since I live right next to the patisserie, I had to go try their new shop. Very hipster feel, with names of the items on their menus printed on regular paper and pinned to a metal board on the wall. Ordered the Chicken Grec and Cubano. I enjoyed the Cubano more, but it would have been nice if the bread was toasted. The Chicken Grec had a little too much herbs for my likings, but will definitely be back to try their other items since they're just down the street and I'm such a fan of their pastries :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Pretty simple:  Just a lunch place.  The market that was here before looked intriguing, but not enough for me to make the small trek over.  But, B Patisserie has been pretty good so far, so I happened to be around the area when it opened, so I thought I'd give it a try.  All of the patisserie offerings I've had have been sweet, so if they can do savory, that'd be impressive.

We tried the grilled cheese.  Simple enough, but the duxelle (looked it up: paste made from mushrooms, etc) really made it awesome.  The bread was unique - a circular slice which made the sandwich like a French quesadilla (as one of the staff called it).  It turned out really well - a little fluffy and grilled with a little butter.  Extremely tasty.
author: masa s.

description: The Grec was suggested to me by numerous friends however upon reaching there it was already sold out. An employee was kind enough to suggest his favorite sandwich, the banh mi which was delicious. A little small for the price you pay though ($8) could get more economical banh mis in Little Saigon and such, but otherwise it was still delicious.
author: Nadine C.

description: Awesome sandwiches, prepared by the order, quickly.  This little spot is the 'offspring' of B Patisserie, kitty-corner across the street.  Rotisserie chicken, Cubano, and Porchetta sandwiches are 'musts'.  I'll be back for sure ASAP.
author: Andy S.

description:
opted for this instead of the original across the street and LOVED it! We both had the Cubano sandwiches and loved the layers of flavor. We had this amazing dessert which was honey baked with vanilla custard (can't remember the name) and wish I had brought 4 home with me. 

We came at lunch hour and while there was a lot of people picking food up to go, we were able to find a table no problem
author: Kara A.

description:
Great sandwiches and the perfect quick lunch spot. They usually have 6-7 specialty sandwiches to choose from - all of which are relatively rich - but delicious. 

Great vibe and decor inside.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Been here twice now- 1st on opening day and 2nd six days later.
After trying the grilled cheese, Cubano, and chicken sandwiches... I still can't decide which one I would rather rather order when I go back. All of them are fantastic.
Sweets - Order a cookie. Any cookie. They are all delicious. 
I'm a huge fan!
author: Jen H.

description:
You can never go wrong with fresh ingredients. From freshly baked breads to freshly chopped veggies. Being a fat vegetarian, of course I went straight for their grilled cheese. I didn't bother reading that it came with mushrooms (not a fan). But oh my goodness!! Whatever magic they sprinkled onto their mushrooms made them taste amazing!  The next time I was in. I tried their Veggie Banh Mi,
Easily the best veggie sandwich ever. Spicy mayo, crispy veggies, topped with fresh cilantro, all on the worlds perfect roll, with the perfect combination of crunch and softness. 
And now there's soup too.  Omg, I love this place!!!!
author: David D.

description:
From the amazing crew of B. Patisserie comes B. on the Go! I just stopped in for a late lunch... tried the Cubano... and WOW! I'll say upfront that I hate pickles... but I loved this sandwich... I would say it is the BEST Cubano I have ever had! Crazy good! Then I had one of their amazing cookies, toffee and cherry and heaven! 
Come here and this will automatically turn into your new lunch spot! 
I literally cannot say it enough I LOVE this place!
author: Kris H.

description:
B on the Go is a sandwich shop; as it has very little seating it is mainly a destination for take out.  

I took home their porchetta sandwich which comes with salsa verde on a ciabatta style roll.  The roll was great.  Likewise the salsa verde.  The porchetta added very little taste wise to the sandwich. Frankly, it would be great if they made a less expensive vegetarian version of this sandwich by doubling down on the incredible salsa verde and leaving out the porchetta. 

The quinoa salad was a wonderful and not too expensive accompaniment to the sandwich.
author: David D.

description: Ordered the pork belly banh mi and walnut cocoa nib cookie. Both were absolutely delicious! So worth the calories!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday February 10, 2013 @ 3pm Soft-Opening
Dining Companions:  Mommy & Husband
Scene:  Pac Heights Denizens in Burberry Scarves + Riding Boots & Asian Families in Red Sweaters or Coats Clutching Chanel Purses 
Music: Urban Contemporary
Decor:  Charming French Patisserie.  Impressive Glass Counters Filled w/ Viennoiserie, Pastries & Tartines.  Bench Banquette Seating, Marble Tables & Cozy Seating Areas by The Windows.  
Service:  Enthusiastic, Sweet, Charming.  Belinda Leong Making the Rounds & Passing Out Generous Samples of their Signature Vanilla Cake.
Imbibe:  Coffee & Tea
Devour:  Complimentary Vanilla Cake(Vanilla Mascarpone, Sable Breton, Vanilla Ganache, Vanilla Sponge Cake, Vanilla Glacage & Vanilla Macaron), Grand Macaron(Vanilla Macaron, Rose Creme Mousseline, Raspberries, Vanilla Powder & Rose Petals), Vanilla Caramel Millefeuille(Puff Pastry w/ Caramel Creme Patisserie & Vanilla Chantilly, Yogurt & Citrus Verrine(Greek Yogurt Panna Cotta, Citrus Cream, Grapefruit & Orange Pulp, Lemon Gelee, Biscuit Jaconde & Purple Wheat-Almond Granola)
Total:  $26.50
Note:  Happy Lunar New Year Everybody!
author: Genevieve Y.

description: The Chicken Grec is great, but I love the Grilled Cheese with Mushroom Duxelle. It's like a Mushroom and Gourmet Cheese Panini. And I usually don't care for grilled cheese sandwiches
author: Roshni K.

description:
I'm honestly surprised this is related in any way to B Patisserie. I had walked by this place a few times, and it was usually crowded (good sign), with a nice-looking menu. I finally stopped in today and tried the banh mi, and I couldn't believe how bad it was.

I was in a hurry, and hungry, so I ate it as quickly as I could, regretting every bite. The bread was chewy and dense, not airy and crisp. The bread was slathered with gobs of American mayonnaise. There was some kind of caramel-fish sauce musk sprayed in one spot of the sandwich to clear my sinuses, and while it was mercifully absent from the remaining bites, so was any flavor apart from rice vinegar carrot sticks. The pork belly was well-cooked so as not to be chewy or rubbery, but its flavor was indiscernible.

I may not be Vietnamese, but I've eaten enough banh mi to know that this was a really sad rendition of one.

Adding insult to injury, they were blaring '80s music for the benefit of the 4 patrons suffering through our late lunches. There was definitely something deeply disturbing about eating this terrible sandwich while being aurally assaulted by Huey Lewis and the News. Sometimes bad is bad, indeed.
author: Richard R.

description: great place been there many times had a sandwich and got a salad to go for next day. will go back again for sure
author: Hanna G.

description: I like the food and get a sandwich here at least once a week since they opened. But I was pretty upset today when the owner skipped right past me in the long line and started making a sandwich for the guy behind me because I guess he is more of a regular. She did the same for another person even further back. Left a bad taste in my mouth. :(
author: Robyn P.

description:
Nice and more quieter than the.original.
Like the.original superior made products
Either people didn't know about this new spot
  People still cram at the original and parklet
author: S.K. Y.

description:
B on the Go is pretty much the only sandwich joint in Pac Heights, and it fits its niche very nicely. I think Belinda realized that the patrons of B Patisserie, across the way, were occasionally saturating their palates with so much sugar from her utterly magnificent desserts that their taste buds were begging for a savory balance. 
And it turns out that the woman is multi-talented: she can create a kouign amann that looks like a toasted golden flower and melts in your mouth like flaky, sugary magic AND she can create a filling, delicious, fresh-tasting sandwich. Do her sandwiches make my taste buds go into fits of ecstasy, like her pastries do? Nope. Are they the best sandwiches in SF? Not by a long shot (though take into account the pretty insane competition--SF might as well stand for Sandwich Fest). Do they have exciting, never-before-seen, creative options? Nope. Do they have amazing bread, considering B's baking talents? Nope. But are they definitely the best in the area, in a super convenient location where they have zero competition, in a pretty space with attentive, cheerful servers? Yes. 
The best sandwich we have tried so far is the Chicken Grec, which has very juicy chicken and an herbed mayo that tastes garden-fresh. That's been the best thing about these sandwiches--very fresh-tasting ingredients that taste healthy in the top-quality, nutritious, fresh way rather than the low-cal way. They're also very good sizes--not too massive and not so small you're hungry a moment later. Their grilled cheese sandwich has gotten some hype, but it's only so-so. The bread for that one is pretty cool, though--it's a round, flat bread that looks somewhat like a crepe (though bread-like rather than pancake-like) and it works nicely. If you're a fan of the absolute, most traditional style of grilled cheese then you'll love this one. As someone more interested in a little pizazz, like exciting cheeses or the addition of roasted mushrooms, I was underwhelmed. 
Added bonus: desserts from B Patisserie are on display as well, so you can get your fix there without waiting in line forever across the street--though the options are more limited. I'm really liking this place right now, and will perhaps love it once their menu expands into more exciting, original options and once it stays open longer--the short hours (11--4) sorta bug me.
author: Ali M.

description: OK, sandwiches are good. Too small maybe and too expensive (8$ for a grilled cheese?!). I loved the venue tho.
author: Viviana D.

description: Paid $13 for a banh mi with tip. This was by far the worst banh mi I have ever tasted in my life. I'm late 20's and half Vietnamese, this was the worst taste to price ratio I've ever experienced. Chicken was boiled/salty, radish and carrots were thick cut and tasted off. The bread was soft, not a baguette, and tasted like something from Safeway. There was no pate. Ridiculous.
author: Jacob J.

description: The vegetarian Bánh mì with cauliflower is a go-to lunch special! I love all of the beautiful textures and taste combinations, its so hearty and healthy!
author: Paris I.

description: The chicken grec sandwich is unreal. And the iced coffee is some of the best I've had. Casual, easy, sunny place, and everyone working there is so friendly. Glad that B Patisserie is expanding its footprint!
author: Caroline B.

description: Cute little eatery adjacent to B Pattiserie. Like it's parent shop, B on the Go is closed Mondays so make note. If you're a fan of B Patisserie's kouign amann then the arlettes are a must try. They are best described as thin, wafer like cookies made from leftover kouign amann dough. The pork belly banh mi sandwich here is to die for!!! Make sure to get it or you'll regret it!!!
author: Derrek O.

description: Big fan of b.patisserie! B. On The Go did not disappoint. Still dreaming of the cauliflower bahn mi and tuna melt! Simple menu. Staff here are very friendly! Feels like a neighborhood spot I will be visiting often.
author: Jennifer N.

description: B on the go is a solid brunch/lunch spot. I'd say they are more like  3.5 than 3 star. The sandwiches I tried were both good; the porchetta and the cubano. I liked the porchetta out of the two. The soup was legit, it was tomato bisque that day (it changes often). The place itself is pretty cool. Seating is open and communal.
author: Mike P.

description: The grilled cheese with mushrooms is delicious and a must try. I've ordered this sandwich a few times already and it tastes just as great as it did the first time I had it. I always order a cookie for dessert. My favorite cookie was the ginger molasses but they don't make it anymore. However, the oatmeal cranberry is also good.  The cookies are a good size and very well made.
author: Candace F.

description:
Great sandwiches made with good bread.  I like their porchetta sandwich, which is pork with some crispy skin. The salsa verde is sour, but it cuts through the fatty meat so it complements it well.  Service is quick. There is a communal table there, but most people seem to order to take out. They roast their meats right there.  The chicken grec was good - with a yogurt based sauce, which is seasoned with garlic.  The cubano was "so so".  The grilled cheese sandwich (with mushrooms) was very good.  The ready-made Italian cold cuts are good if you're in a hurry.

Lemon sable was great.   These are sugar glazed, and the lemon flavor is nice, just like when you get good madeleines.

Their shrubs are interesting drinks made with fermented fruit juice and soda. Worth trying and it's refreshing.

I like the fact that they make a few things well, instead of suffering through a wide range of offerings where nothing is done well.

(Update: I had the porchetta again, and the salsa verde wasn't as tart as before, so I kind of miss the old way, but I think other people think it was too sour, so maybe they adjusted it)
author: Dan C.

description: Had the cubano sandwich.  Was ok, nothing great.  Was definitely on the small size too.  Other/better sandwich options abound.
author: Dilly M.

description: Definitely the spot to fulfill your tuna sandwich cravings and plum desserts.  I love the decor and setup of the place.  For sure I will be back next time I visit San Francisco! (:
author: Janine A.

description: Love this new addition to the neighborhood. We had the grilled cheese (it has tons of mushrooms in it-yum!) and the cubano.  I really want to try the chicken grec and the tuna melt. The staff was very friendly: the sandwich maker chatted with us while we waited in line and the cashier did a good job managing our expectations. Besides the longish line, you couldn't tell that they had just opened their doors for business. They also have fruit shrubs. Wow, I'm realizing I need to get back there ASAP!
author: Jacqueline S.

description: Had lunch here today. Bahn Mi...it was so good, I could have eaten another one. Visiting SF and enjoying all the fine food places. This is at the top!
author: Steve H.

description: High quality sandwiches that fit small stomachs more than big hairy man bellies. Greece doesn't handle money or country economics well but the chicken grec sandwich   yummy and fiscally sound.
author: t t.

description: Simple sandwich menu but they offer salad alternatives for each. I had the banh mi as a salad and it was delicious. My wife had the tuna melt and enjoyed it too. Price was very reasonable for the area and the service was quick. A few more menu items would keep me coming back much more often.
author: Ash R.

description:
My best friend was visiting from the south bay, and we had to try the brand-new sister location to One of my favorite bakeries in the city. When we arrived we found the decor to be open and quite inviting. So we went ahead and order two of the best looking sandwiches we saw.  Tried the chicken sandwich which was very delicious, but quite over priced at $10.75 given the size. I passed on the $4 quinoa salad since I wasn't in the mood to spend over $20 for lunch. 

My friend order the Cubano sandwich which he found very satisfying and loved the Panini style that it was prepared. He also left hungry after only eating the sandwich. 
I have no doubt there will be lines out the door for months, but one visit was enough for me at b. on the go.

Three stars for delicious food but love value to price ratio.
author: Mizrahi T.

description:
I really love the food here. I dream about the chicken grec. Food five stars! I removed one star for the seating situation, which is primarily a communal table. It really doesn't seem like the best use of space, and is pretty tight and unwelcoming. Also, the sun beats (!) into the restaurant (sun beating uncomfortably at my back as I write), so about half the seating is really uncomfortable a good part of the time. Maybe this is purposeful not to encourage lingering, a bit frustrating nonetheless. 
Great job on the food!
author: Gingersnappy T.

description:
Yelp find!
Awsome sadwich place. I want to come back soon to try everything else on the menu.
Today I had the porcetta sandwich and a side of the Brussels sprout salad. I was served the Brussels sandwich with the side of Brussels sprouts. But when I pointed it out they were quick to switch out for the porcetta I was craving.
author: Curt B.

description: Girlfriend was quite excited about this place. Especially since I think their pastries is one of the best, if not THE BEST.
