Was going to order the chicken grec, looks delicious from all the pictures. Changed my mind and got a banh mi. Definitely doesn't compare to a real sandwich restaurant like Dinosaurs. But nonetheless it was ok. Lacked a lot of the amazing flavors it needs. Girlfriend ordered the Cubano, which she was literally jumping up in down for, until she ate it. She said it was missing the tart taste of the mustard. Next time, I have to try their chicken grec to see what the bees are buzzing for.
author: nick r.

description: My $11 Cubano was very tasty, service friendly. Minus 1 star for slightly slow service, I watched the staff work, they are still learning and will hopefully be more efficient shortly.
author: Poppy C.

description: Best sandwiches ever! Anything you try is delicious! I really recommend the potatoes, the chicken sandwich with yoghurt and cilantro sauce and the porcetta. The home made drinks are very tasty and refreshing. Make sure you leave room for a decadent cookie. The space is filled with intoxicated aromas and friendly staff.
author: Sonali M.

description:
B on the go is a cute cafe where you could easily take a quick meeting or grab a sandwich. 
It opened just 4 months ago so I believe the menu is intentionally limited. But I had the tuna melt which was tasty (though it would have been nice with a small salad). And the bahn mi salad my fiancé ordered was also great
author: Kaego R.

description: Porchetta sandwich and molasses ginger cookie, both startlingly delicious. My first time eating here, but it's already tied for favorite lunch in the city (with Nopalito).
author: Lulu L.

description: I was not impressed with the two sandwiches I tried.  The chicken on the grec and the porchetta were only okay, nothing to write home about.  Where B. reigns is the kouign ammans.  Unfortunately, you'll have to purchase those across the street.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I really really LOVE their sandwiches..... BUT...S........L......O......W..... service..They need to get rid of mr. man-bun.... he is inept!!! It took 35 minutes for me to get 2 sandwiches togo... and these were not even the hot sandwich...The man needs to be retrained or move on to something he is more suitable to do. 1) There are 5 customers in front of me.... took me 15 mins just to get to the order ... lucky for him, the cash register crash and the manager-like lady took over... the line behind me grew to about 12+  people. In less than 10 mins, she shrank the line to just 1.... meanwhile, I am waiting waiting for my sandwiches... bahn mi and the porchetta. The man in front of me got his sandwich... 3 people behind got their sandwiches.... i am still waiting for mines..... finally, man-bun called me and another customer.... he gets ready to give me mines, but the other customer starts asking him for something..... he stops getting my sandwiches ready to give to me and tend to the other customer...WTF....... take care of the customer one at a time and take care of the one who was there waiting already..... his response ...."i'm doing the best I can'.... if that is that best, then don't bother coming here for a quick lunch.... it will take at least 35 minutes to get ur sandwich ....... I get that it's a new place and they may be working out the 'kinks'.... standing there for 35 min, i had plenty time to watch the movement of the staff....everyone but one seems to move pretty quickly....
author: Jay S.

description: Really good sandwiches...beautiful open space...just wish there were some more options on the menu
author: Rahul M.

description: I live right around the corner, and my only complaint is they aren't open when I'm home very often. The grilled cheese, banh mi, and chicken grecco sandwiches are all to die for. They are nice and quick and each sandwich is somehow better than the last. It wouldn't hurt you to add a madeleine for a dessert snack either. Enjoy! You can't go wrong!
author: Lindsey H.

description: I found multiple bone fragments inside my chicken Grec, not very pleased...
author: Andul H.

description: We love B Patisserie and were excited to try B on the Go, especially after reading the review in the New Fillmore.  But, we were so disappointed!  We ordered the Mushroom Grilled Cheese.  After waiting 15 minutes, we were happy to receive our sandwiches, then so surprised when we discovered a soggy cold sandwich!  When we picked up half the sandwich, the filling fell through the soggy bread, and the sandwich fell apart. And it was not appetizing cold. I think they must have forgotten about the sandwiches after they took them off the grill. I know it's just a sandwich, but it was a huge disappointment (and almost $10 a sandwich).
author: P C.

description: Glad to have a good sandwich shop in the neighborhood. The cubano was excellent. I'd head to Bun Mee on Fillmore for a banh mi sandwich though - the one here was too salty and greasy when I tried it.
author: Steve D.

description: Tried the Chicken Grec several months ago and had been dreaming of it ever since.  The yogurt herbed mayo was to die for.  Today I finally had it again.....and it was a bit different.  This time the sandwich had way more chicken and less of the yummy sauce. Wish it could go back to the way it was.
author: Robyn H.

description: Ate at B on the Go today. We ordered the Cubana, Tuna and Porchetta. The Cubana was great. The bread was soft and cheese melted just right. Great ham and pork and pickles and mustard. Perfection. The Porchetta needs a lot of help. The menu says it comes with salsa verde on the sandwich. I could find none. It was tasteless. The pork was extremely fatty and so grizzled.  Whoever is cooking the Porchetta needs to understand that the pork needs to be tasty and moist and just full of flavor. I was very disappointed. The Porchetta truck at The Embarcadero on Saturday's has a much better sandwich. Other then the disappointing Porchetta it was great. The staff is organized and the restaurant is clean and they have a good system for ordering.
author: Debbie P.

description: Been here a couple of times and each time it takes forever to order and receive food - even when there is not many people in line. For a sandwich shop with premade salads, I don't understand what takes so long. Hopefully this improves but food is pretty good anyways.
author: Sean S.

description: I really, really wanted to love this place since I work form home & live around the corner.  I was so disappointed with the amount of meat/lack of flavor in the Cubano sandwich - all you can taste is bread.  My friend also go the Chicken Grec, which had more filling but the taste was just ok.  There was just nothing to love or rave about, including the service.  I waited 10 minutes for my sandwich & wished so badly that they served espresso drinks.  When I asked about lattes, I was told (with attitude! perhaps they get this question a lot?) that I could go across the street to get one from the original location.  Say what?!?  Did they really just suggest that I go across the street & wait in line another 10 minutes during my lunch hour???  I can only get away from my desk for an hour at lunch-- maximum.  Do I want to spend my lunchtime shuffling from one shop to another?  Nah.  Not worth it.    Honestly, I don't know how they have gotten so many 5 star reviews.  The sandwiches are just average.  I expected they would be as good as Bi-Rite's, then I would definitely keep coming back for more.  The original B is fantastic, but so disappointed that this shop misses the mark on sandwiches, lunchtime atmosphere & friendly service.
author: Mika D.

description: went there today and they didn't seem on the ball and got confused on our order by missing a sandwich. service was pretty inattentive and very slow. good sandwiches but not as good as across the road at their original location. albeit they have just opened.
author: Ian V.
